etymology.description: 想 “to think” + 象/像 “image; appearance” = form images in the mind → imagine; imagination.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of thinking with images to express mentally picturing things not present. Used as both a verb (to imagine) and a noun (imagination).
etymology.simplification: Mainland standardizes 想像 → 想象 by replacing 像 with 象 to align with the ‘image/phenomenon’ sense and unify with words like 形象/现象; an orthographic standardization rather than stroke reduction.

examples.chinese: 我无法想象没有音乐的生活(我無法想像沒有音樂的生活)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ wúfǎ xiǎngxiàng méiyǒu yīnyuè de shēnghuó.
examples.english: I can’t imagine a life without music.

examples.chinese: 孩子的想象力很丰富(孩子的想像力很豐富)。
请你想象一下未来的城市(請你想像一下未來的城市)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ xiǎngxiàng yīxià wèilái de chéngshì.
examples.english: Please imagine what future cities will be like.
